result.execSummary:
The defendant Melissa J Vervooren was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Injury by Intoxicated Use/Vehicle, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.25(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Hearing March 18, 2015.
**3/18/2015 $40,000.00 payable to Frodert Hospital; and $703.00 payable to Home Care Medical.  To be collected by  DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) Wis. stats.  Restitution to receive first priority over all other costs, fees, surcharges and/or fines.  Failure to pay by the end of supervision will result in a civil judgment.

All court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA surcharge and restitution.
To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  To be paid by end of supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain fulltime emloyment/education/vocation unless a doctor indicates she is unable to do so.

No alcohol or drugs.
No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.

Follow all rules of supervision. Follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
All applicable fees of upservision by end of supervision.
AODA assessment.   Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute/maintain sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Operating privileges for operation of Class D vehicles is restricted to operating vehicles that are equipped with an ignition interlock device, and each motor vehicle for which the defendant's name appears on the vehicle's certificate of title or registration must be equipped with an ignition interlock device beginnig on the date the department issues any license and for a period of two years thereafter.
Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and driver Safety Plan signed and filed.

Provide a DNA sample.
Defendant advised that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm; and that her voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

$40,000.00 payable to Froedtert Hospital and $703.00 payable to Home Care Medical.  
Restitution to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b), Wis. Stats.  Restitution to receive first priority over all other costs, fees, surcharges, and/or fines.  Failure to pay by the end of supervision will result in civil judgment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Melissa J Vervooren in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PSI reviewed and corrections made.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  5.5 YEARS with 0 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program but is NOT eligible for the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation unless a doctor indicates she is unable to do so.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered Intoxicated Driver Assessment; form filed; copy to defendant.

Court ordered defendant's operating privileges revoked for 2 YEARS with the mandatory reinstatement fee.  

Defendant's operating privilege for operation of Class D vehicles is restricted to operating vehicles that are equipped with an ignition interlock device; and each motor vehicle for which the defendant's name appears on the vehicle's certificate of title or registration must be equipped with an ignition interlock device beginning on the date the department issues any license and for a period of  2 YEARS  thereafter.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Fine in the amount of $0; 
Restitution to be determined in the future; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of her right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that she may not vote until her civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Victim Impact Statement    
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Photographs from Accident Scene
Letters in Support of the Defendant

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Case adjourned for restitution hearing in Branch 22.  Restitution hearing scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Dept of Corrections Memorandum received and filed.  Parties notified memorandum is ready for pick up in Branch 22.

Defendant Melissa J Vervooren in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Case was calendared for sentencing this date.  Defense request for an adjourned sentencing date is granted by the court. m   Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 02-24-2015 at 01:30 pm.
PSI received and filed.  Parties notified report is available for pickup in Branch 22.

Defendant Melissa J Vervooren in court with attorney Victoria M. McCandless.  Thomas Potter for Francesco G. Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pursuant to plea negotiations Counts 2-7 are dismissed but read in for the purpose of sentencing.  As to Count 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead NO CONTEST and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that her voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Court Orders PSI report.  Order for Presentence Investigation Report (PSI) signed and FILED.  Defendant address and phone number confirmed.

Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Melissa J Vervooren in court with attorney Victoria M. McCandless.  Francesco G. Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for plea hearing, but Branch 22 is in Jury Trial.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 30, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Victoria McCandless appears before Madame Clerk Brenda to adjourn Plea Hearing, previously scheduled for 08-14-2014 at 01:30am to a later date.  ADA Francesco Mineo appears telephonically.  Plea Hearing adjourned to 09-03-2014 at 01:30pm in Branch 22.

Defendant Melissa J Vervooren in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Plea hearing scheduled for 08-14-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Melissa J Vervooren in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin on behalf of Francesco Mineo.
Court admonishes defendant for her late appearance in this court and informs her that a timely appearance is required for scheduled hearings.  Court also informs Mr Vervooren that further late appearances will not be tolerated and any further incident of late appearances could affect her bail.  For reasons stated on the record, Pretrial Conference is adjourned to a later date in Branch 22.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 06-30-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Melissa J Vervooren in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin  on behalf of Francesco G Mineo.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 05-27-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Melissa J Vervooren in court with attorney Victoria M. McCandless.  Thomas Potter for Francesco G. Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No driving without a valid license.  DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (3/12/14). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 03-19-2014 at 08:30 am.

Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.vb
